brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to determine the feasibility and accuracy of an automated
      adherence monitoring system, and to compare the variance between urine and oral fluid
      riboflavin levels when specimens are obtained 'as usual' and after a one-hour inter specimen
      interval.

clinical_study.brief_title: Adherence Monitoring For Substance Abuse Clinical Trials

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Male or female, aged 18 to 60

          -  Ability to give informed consent.

          -  Be willing and able to use the study-provided phone for taking and transmitting
             capsule photos.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Unwilling or unable to use a cell phone.

          -  Any medical, psychiatric, or other condition that, in the opinion of the
             investigator, would preclude safe, consistent, or useful participation in the study.

facility.name: Addiction & Pharmacology Research Lab, St. Luke's Hospital

primary_outcome.measure: Variance between urine and oral fluid riboflavin levels when specimens are obtained 'as usual' and after a one-hour inter specimen interval

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: California Pacific Medical Center Research Institute

clinical_study.source: California Pacific Medical Center Research Institute

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case-Only, Time Perspective: Prospective
